file_content.text: The dam base is gutted, our Imperial traitor awaits execution. I can't thank you enough.
I heard the explosions from here. Well done.
And evidence of our Imperial traitor! Thank you. He'll answer for my men's lives.
Ulgo's control over this region is shattered, and you've saved many lives. Thank you.
My pleasure.
We don't deserve your generosity.
It was nothing.
Your modesty is impressive, but not as much as your deeds.
Credit me for this victory.
Every member of my house will know your name. I promise.
You've cut Ulgo to the bone today--and now Thul will scrape their wound raw.
The Ulgos are vulnerable. Hit them hard!
Alderaan's never felt so cold. Must have lost more blood than I thought.
My apologies. I thought you all were a Thul rescue party at first. Didn't know I'd be this lucky.
Forgive me. I hoped a Thul rescue party would find me, but a Sith... I'm honored, my lord.
Excuse me. I was hoping for a Thul rescue party, but an Imperial agent... even better.
Sorry. I was hoping for a Thul rescue party, but a bounty hunter's even better.
Forgive my rambling--I'm Gevin Thul. Didn't think I'd live to see another friendly face.
My assault team was ambushed. They're--they're all dead.
How were you ambushed? Tell me everything.
What happened?
How'd you manage to escape?
Yet you survived?
Instinct and luck. House Thul trains their operatives well.
So they're dead. What's new?
We knew the consequences. House Thul's special ops don't boast high survival rates.
We were conducting a covert operation at the nearby dam. Ulgo recently turned it into a military base.
Orders were simple: Infiltrate the dam and blow the generators. Somehow the Ulgos found out.
Let me guess: They lured you in, sprung a trap.
So they were ready for you.
Someone must have betrayed your plans.
You've got a leak.
You may be right.
Where do I come in?
I just... when I saw you here, I thought we might have a chance to recover from this debacle.
The Ulgos have elite guards stationed there, just waiting. I even saw one of their top generals.
Thought I saw him receive a holocall from an Imperial during the fight.
The general must have been updating his source.
That Imperial's your traitor.
Likely so, but until I have a name, there's no one to accuse.
The Empire's at war with Ulgo. You're positive it was an Imperial?
An Imperial? You're sure?
I think so. If I'm right, he could be the one who leaked our plans.
You're boring me.
Whatever I saw, it can wait. The mission takes priority, and only you can complete it.
The Ulgos won't expect another attack so soon. You can blow up their generators if you strike now.
Why stop with generators? I'll burn the entire base.
I'll blow up more than that.
Best to keep this blaze controlled.
I love the smell of fear.
Let's burn some Ulgos.
You'll get your new perfume soon enough.
When I'm done, you'll see the blaze from here.
I'll light the dam on fire.
I can't wait.
The day's not complete until I've blown something up.
I do love a good explosion.
Then you'll enjoy my toys.
Just fill me in already.
These high-yield thermite explosives will destroy those generators easily.
If you find evidence of our betrayal, bring it to me. Don't get sidetracked though--the generators are the primary objective.
Not worth it. [Refuse quest]
I'm sorry you think so. The Ulgos won't be vulnerable long.
I'm sorry, I--I must conserve my energy.
The Ulgos weren't expecting this defeat. You've served House Thul well.
